intro: Epichrocantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Epichrocantha is native to tropical and subtropical regions and thrives in warm, humid climates. It is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
